articles.title: UN alarm as Ukraine nuclear power plant shelled again - BBC
articles.description: Ukraine and Russia trade blame as the Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant, Europe's largest, is hit.
articles.content:
More shelling of Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant has been reported, with Ukraine and Russia again blaming each other for the attack.
Each side said there were 10 hits on the plant's admin… [+4099 chars]

articles.author: Jack Guy, CNN
articles.title: Europe reels as repeated heatwaves cause chaos - CNN
articles.description: Western Europe was battling Thursday to deal with the fallout from extreme heat and drought, with wildfires causing evacuations in France and Italian farmers losing up to 80% of their harvest due to severe drought.

articles.title: Europe’s Key Rivers Fall to Critical Levels, Aggravating Energy Crunch - The Wall Street Journal
articles.description: Scorching temperatures have drained some of Europe’s main rivers, threatening to disrupt vital economic thoroughfares and exacerbate the continent’s energy shortage.

articles.title: TRADE DISPUTE: SA citrus farmers feel the squeeze after EU detains more than 1000 containers of produce - Daily Maverick
articles.description: South Africa’s citrus association says it hopes the European Union will clear hundreds of containers of produce detained at European ports ‘in coming days’.
